ai.summary: A scenic 7.6 km woodland loop near Hindhead in Surrey, offering a moderate hike through Golden Valley's mixed woodland and open heath. The route combines shaded forest trails with gentle climbs and occasional viewpoints, suitable for walkers with some experience and solid footing.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly forest tracks with soft earth and some compact gravel. Expect uneven ground, exposed roots, and a few short ascents. There are shaded sections as well as open glades where sun may appear.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy boots with good grip. The trails can be uneven and slippery when wet. Watch for roots and loose stones. Insect protection is advised; check for ticks after woodland hikes. Carry water, a light rain shell, and a map or GPS. Stay on marked paths; weather can change quickly in woodland. Daylight hours are shorter in winter.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn offer the best conditions for this route; it can be hiked year round, but winter mud and reduced daylight may affect the experience.

seo.title: Golden Valley Woodland Walk, Hindhead – 7.6 km Moderate Hike in Surrey, UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Golden Valley Woodland Walk near Hindhead. A 7.6 km moderate hike through woodland and heath in Surrey, UK. Practical safety tips and gear for an enjoyable day out.
